title: ‘Tom boy’ Anneka Rice admits Strictly Come Dancing has got her into dresses
text:
She’s bought three dresses this week! (Picture: BBC)

Anneka Rice has admitted that Strictly Come Dancing helped her to get in touch with her feminine side – despite being a self-confessed tomboy.

The 61-year-old TV presenter appeared on the current series of the dance competition with partner Kevin Clifton, and although they were the second couple to leave the show she still found the experience very rewarding.

Anneka told the Radio Times: ‘I have discovered that I have a real disconnect with dancing, which is strange as I can play the piano, as well as tennis and other sports that involve coordination and rhythm. But learning is definitely not a one-size-fits-all experience.

‘I joined Strictly as an out-and-out tomboy and so I have been utterly overwhelmed at how feminine dancing made me feel.

‘I’ve even bought three dresses this week, which has been the most surprising outcome of it all.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Anneka has taken part in a number of reality shows over the years including Come Dine With Me, Celebrity Hunted, and Hell’s Kitchen, but she admitted she felt completely out of her comfort zone when it comes to dancing.

She said: ‘I feel so awkward about dancing. No one in my family has ever seen me dance and I’ve never done any classes or anything like that. I don’t know why, but I thought this was the year to learn.’

Following her swift exit, Anneka insisted she didn’t have ‘one negative’ from her brief time on the show.

She added: ‘I’ve just loved this whole thing; I’ve not one negative about the whole experience. We’ve worked really hard, I’m covered in bruises. I love this man, it’s been a joy to have that honour, that privilege of learning to dance.’

Anneka with her dance partner Kevin Clifton (Picture: Guy Levy/BBC)

Dev Griffin and dance partner Dianne Buswell shocked both viewers and judges after their shock eviction from the BBC show last weekend.

The pair were the third couple eliminated from this year’s series, despite consistently high scores.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One and BBC iPlayer.

description: Anneka Rice admits Strictly Come Dancing helped her get in touch with feminine side.
